derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: via Latin from Greek Mausōleion, from Mausōlos, the name of a king of Caria (4th cent. bc), to whose tomb in Halicarnassus the name was originally applied

entry.def: A mausoleum is a building which contains the grave of a famous person or the graves of a rich family.

means.word_mean: 1. a large burial chamber, usually above ground
